result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $3781.00payable to Wells Fargo Bank.
All MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 0 (zero) days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 2 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with Wells Fargo or Chase Banks, Biana P., John A., Katie W. Nekisha W. Arlene P. Lanier B., Sasho O., Ebony J. or Jessica R.

- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
 - Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- No dangerous weapons.
Consecutive to: with 0 (zero) days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 1 and to any other sentence.

Filed forwarded to Branch 28 Per Wisconsin Court of Appeals Order Dated February 11, 2022 - Remanded to Circuit Court to Conduct an Evidentiary Hearing.

Per Order dated February 11, 2022, Appeal No 2021AP645-W, 
IT IS ORDERED that this matter is remanded to the circuit court to conduct an evidentiary hearing and enter a written order with findings of fact as discussed above relevant to Lusk's claims that he received in effective assistance from his appellate counsel, Attorney Parker Mathers. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the circuit court shall conduct the hearing required by this order and make the necessary findings within seventy-five days of the date of this order. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the respondent shall order a transcript of the hearing within ten days after the completion of the hearing. The court reporter shall have twenty days from the date the transcript is ordered to prepare and file the transcript. The State shall provide a copy of this order to the court reporter. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit the record in this matter to the clerk of this court within twenty days of the date that the transcript of the post-remand hearing is filed in the circuit court. The record shall include, at a minimum, documents filed pursuant to this remand, the transcript or transcripts of proceedings held pursuant to this remand, and the circuit court's order addressing the issues on remand. If the original records from Milwaukee County case No. 2015CF87 are retrieved for use at the remand hearing, they shall be transmitted as part of the record. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the parties and the court may request extensions of the deadlines in this order as circumstances may require.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody at Green Bay Correctional.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES ALL Defense motions addressed in open court.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Antuan J. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 102 MONTHS with 0 (zero) days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 2 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 72 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 102 MONTHS with 0 (zero) days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 1 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 72 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS NOT the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- No dangerous weapons.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with Wells Fargo or Chase Banks, Biana P., John A., Katie W. Nekisha W. Arlene P. Lanier B., Sasho O., Ebony J. or Jessica R.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $3781.00payable to Wells Fargo Bank.
All MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement.
-From the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Jury in at 9:56 a.m.  

On the same day, at the hour of 9:57 a.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:
.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Robbery of a Financial Institution, as charged in the Information.  Dated this 27th day of January, 2017. Foreperson Arthur K."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Robbery of a Financial Institution, as charged in the Information.  Dated this 27th day of January, 2017. Foreperson Arthur K."
.
Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed. Court discharged the jury. Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to both counts. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Carl D Lusk not in court, in custody and not produced to the courtroom.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  

Jury in the box at 8:40 a.m. 

Trial continued.  For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered everyone out of the courtroom while exhibit videos are viewed in open court for continued deliberations. Court ordered jury out of the box at 9:11 a.m. for further deliberations. Court put sidebar conversation and discussion amongst parties on the record in open court. Defense counsel opposed Court denying his client's appearance in open court during deliberating of jury viewing video. State put on the record in open court as to presence of individuals in court during viewing of video.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in at 4:40 p.m. For reasons stated on the record as to several exhibits received and viewing of video exhibit. Court excused jury for the evening at 4:42 p.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial for continued deliberations in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Carl D Lusk not in court, in custody and not produced to the courtroom.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. In court discussion amongst parties as to exhibits requested from the jury GRANTED by the Court. State and defense does not object. Exhibits forwarded to jury for review upon request.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Jury in the box at 1:24 p.m.

Trial continued. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:25 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Do who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

In court motion by the state placed on the record in open court. Jury in the box at 10:06 a.m. Trial continued.  Re-Sworn for the state: Lieutenant Madrina Dela Cruz. Exhibit #'s 50 through 56 offered, received, admitted and published to the jury from the state. Exhibit #'s 58 through 70, 71, 72, 73, 74, 75, 76, 77 & 78 offered, received, admitted and published to the jury from the state. Re-Sworn for the state: Detective David Anderson. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 10:38 a.m.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Court held colliquy with the defendant as to his right to testify or not to testify. Defendant reserves his 5th amendment right to remain silent. Jury in the box 11:06 a.m.  Defense rests. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box and excused at 11:07 a.m. for lunch. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37 at 1:00 p.m.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. In court discussion related to juror #3 placed on the record in open court. Jury in the box at 2:01 p.m.

Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Arlene P. Exhibit #'s 23 offered, received and admitted from the state. Sworn for the state: Jessica R. Exhibit #'s 24 offered, received and admitted from the state. Jury out of the box at 2:37 p.m. Sworn for the state: Pamela I. For reasons stated on the record, Court held colliquy with the witness. Jury in the box at 2:43 p.m. Exhibit #'s 25 and 26 offered, received, admitted and published to the jury from the state. Sworn for the state: Investigator Matthew Gibson and Detective Gary Thundercloud. Jury out of the box for a break at 3:16 p.m. Jury in the box at 3:34 p.m. Exhibit # 27 and 29 through 41 offered, received and admitted and published as viewing in open court from the state.  Re-Sworn for the state: Detective Gilbert Carrasco. Exhibit #'s 42 through 48 and 49 offered, received and admitted from the state. Sworn for the state: Lieutenant Madrina Dela Cruz. State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury excused for the evening at 4:44 p.m. Sidebar conversations placed on the record along with in Court discussion. Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 37 on January 26, 2017 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Jury in the box at 9:28 a.m.

Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Retired Police Officer Robert S-O., Lanier B. Exhibit #'s 20 offered, received and admitted from the state. Sworn for the state: Nekisha W., Katie W. and Detective David Anderson. Jury out of box at 10:28 a.m., Court excused for break. Jury in the box at 11:03 a.m. Sworn for the state: Bianca P. Exhibit #'s 21, 22 offered, received, admitted and published to the jury from the state. Jury excused for lunch at 11:21 a.m. Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 37 at 1:30 p.m. In court discussion and sidebar conversations amongst parties placed on the record in open court.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Jury in the box at 2:10 p.m.

Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Detective Ronald Taylor. Exhibit # 7 published to the jury in open court. Sworn for the state: Ebony J. Exhibilt #'s 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 through 19 offered, received and admitted from the state. Sworn for the state: John A. Jury out of the box at 3:10 p.m. for 10 minute break. Jury in the box at 3:39 p.m. Sworn for the state: Ronald Witucki from State Laboratory. Re-sworn for the state: Detective Gilbert Carrasco and MPD Officer Richard Jacobs. Jury excused for the evening at 4:15 p.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial on January 25, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. In court discussion amongst parties placed on the record in open court.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Jury in the box at 9:36 a.m. 

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Trial proceeded. Sworn for the state: Detective Gilbert Carrasco. Exhibit # 1 published to the jury in open court. Jury out of the box at 10:26 a.m. for a 10 minute break. Jury in the box at 10:45 a.m. Sworn for the state: Sasha O. Exhibit #'s 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 offered, received and admitted by the state. Sworn for the state: Schelli S. Jury excused for lunch at 11:48 a.m. Exhibit # 2 offered, received and admitted by the state. Sidebar conversation put on the record in open court.  Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37 on January 24, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Carl D Lusk in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Carl D Lusk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Jury panel in court at 2:20 p.m.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:45 p.m.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed. Jury excused for the evening at 4:00 p.m. In court discussion from the state placed on the record in open Court. In chambers discussion as to juror strikes put on the record. In depth conversation placed on the record amongst parties in open court. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for January 24, 2017 at 09:00 am.
